intro: Simbuleta bellidifolia var. genuina, commonly known as the Sierra Madre bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, shrub-like appearance. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. This species is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
